201601.summary:
The Campus-level event of Hult Prize, the world’s biggest socio-entrepreneurship competition for students is being organised by the Jadavpur University E-cell since the past three years. With a prize money of $1 Million on offer for the international winner, it is often referred to as the “ Students’ Nobel Prize” .
The legacy was carried forward with the bigger and better Third edition of Hult Prize@Jadavpur University in November 2017 organised with unprecedented zeal. The event saw the participation of more than 45 teams of budding social entrepreneurs from across Jadavpur University, with ideas to “Harness the Power of Energy and affect the life of 10 Million people by 2025.” The participants were judged by eminent personalities, industry veterans working in the Renewable Energy sector and members of the India Angel Investors.
Team Let’s Hope reached great heights with their app-based model that focused on creating a database of all the refugees. This would provide them assistance in welfare operations and creating new job prospects.
Team Let’s Hope reached great heights with their app-based model that focused on creating a database of all the refugees. This would provide them assistance in welfare operations and creating new job prospects.
201601.name: Hult Prize

201701.summary:
The Campus-level event of Hult Prize, the world’s biggest socio-entrepreneurship competition for students is being organised by the Jadavpur University E-cell since the past three years. With a prize money of $1 Million on offer for the international winner, it is often referred to as the “ Students’ Nobel Prize” .
The legacy was carried forward with the bigger and better Third edition of Hult Prize@Jadavpur University in November 2017 organised with unprecedented zeal. The event saw the participation of more than 45 teams of budding social entrepreneurs from across Jadavpur University, with ideas to “Harness the Power of Energy and affect the life of 10 Million people by 2025.” The participants were judged by eminent personalities, industry veterans working in the Renewable Energy sector and members of the India Angel Investors.
Team SWAF, lead by Soumya Mondal won this year’s campus event and has directly qualified for the Regional Finals to be held in March 2018.
201701.name: Hult Prize

201702.summary: In partnership with Developer Circles from Facebook. One of the biggest coding events of Kolkata, it invited euphoric young minds to design Apps and pitch it as a business model! With the Winning team bagging the coveted FbStart Membership, Hackathon 2017 was indeed a huge success!
201702.name: FB Hackathon

201704.summary:
'Ideas for Change' - in collaboration with the Dainik Jagran was a step forward in creating awareness and inspiring the young minds to think along the lines of innovation, to seek solutions to the problems that are crippling our nation in the form of business plans. The model ideas were intended to improve the conditions under seven domains or 'Saat Sarokar'', as they were called. The ideas were judged by the esteemed Gaurav Kapoor (IIMC-Innovation Park) and Vaibhav Limaye (Dainik Jagaran).
• Hackathon in partnership with Developer Circles from Facebook. One of the biggest coding events of Kolkata, it invited euphoric young minds to design Apps and pitch it as a business model! With the Winning team bagging the coveted FbStart Membership, Hackathon 2017 was indeed a huge success!
• NIVT- The most trending buzzword these days is without any doubts- Data Analytics. As a part of the two-day E-Weekend, E-Cell hosted a workshop on Big Data Analysis along with one of the top 10 institutes in India in the field- NIVT.The two-day workshop spanned across the basics of Hadoop and Sentiment Analysis along with hands-on training.The event saw an overwhelming participation from students across Jadavpur University and Kolkata.
201704.name: E Weekend

201705.summary: Startup Weekend 4.0 in association with Jadavpur University E-Cell powered by Google for Entrepreneurs was a movement of active and empowered entrepreneurs, learning the tricks of founding startups and launching successful ventures. Teams organically formed around the top ideas as determined by popular vote and after a 54-hour frenzy of business model creation, coding, designing, and market validation, the weekends culminated with presentations in front of local entrepreneurial leaders with another opportunity for critical feedback.
201705.name: Startup Weekend

201708.summary:
On 17th October 2017, along with the British Deputy High Commission and the Jadavpur University Debating Society, the Jadavpur University E-cell organised the biggest inter-college debating event in the city – “The Great Britain Debate”- Where we seek to make a difference, where we take what is ours.
With the British Deputy High Commissioner Mr.Bruce Bucknell and Ms. Sujata Sen - CEO of Future Hope and former Director of the British Council as judges for the day, teams from across Kolkata engaged in a war of words- not to win titles, but to win hearts!
201708.name: The Great Debate

201710.summary: In collaboration with the Dainik Jagran was a step forward in creating awareness and inspiring the young minds to think along the lines of innovation, to seek solutions to the problems that are crippling our nation in the form of business plans. The model ideas were intended to improve the conditions under seven domains or 'Saat Sarokar, as they were called. The ideas were judged by the esteemed Gaurav Kapoor (IIMC-Innovation Park) and Vaibhav Limaye (Dainik Jagaran).

201711.summary: The most trending buzzword these days is without any doubts- Data Analytics. As a part of the two-day E-Weekend,  E-Cell hosted a workshop on Big Data Analysis along with one of the top 10 institutes in India in the field, NIVT.The two-day workshop spanned across the basics of Hadoop and Sentiment Analysis along with hands-on training.The event saw an overwhelming participation from students across Jadavpur University and Kolkata.
201711.name: Data Analytics Workshop

201712.summary: Facebook along with Youth Ki Awaaz came to Jadavpur University. Youth Ki Awaaz and Jadavpur University E-Cell in association with Facebook organised a one-of-a-kind #MyStartUpStory workshop, and session on how Facebook can help young entrepreneurs scale their business via Social Media Marketing. It gave the students a chance to learn the ropes of how to use social media, Facebook, WhatsApp and Instagram for branding and marketing your startup or business/innovative idea, from the man himself, Rajat Arora - Policy Programs Manager at Facebook for India and South Asia.
201712.name: FB on Campus
